metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Oliver, the shadow-child in the Shadowcursed Lands. Oliver wishes for the player to be his playmate, and engages in a game of hide and seek. Oliver seems to be a soul trapped by the curse for a 100 years, but the player will gradually realise over the course of the act that he is in fact a shadow version of Thaniel, the spirit of the land. Oliver possesses Thaniel's heart, and the curse cannot be lifted until it is returned. Oliver does not want to do this - he's made his own little 'family' using cursed beings in the area. If the player challenges him about Thaniel, Oliver will flee towards the town square, where a final confrontation will take place.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Approach 76.337; 43.63; 39.46 and speak to Oliver (he will be invisible at first/dialogue will trigger on sight)

8.speaker: Oliver
8.text: Not back to gloat, are you? Nobody likes a bad winner.

19.speaker: Oliver
19.text: I still think you might have tricked me. If you did - I'll figure it out.

13.speaker: Oliver
13.context: NodeContext: On alert - sensing the player means him harm

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You were too good for me.

135.speaker: Oliver
135.text: Let's play again - you might be able to even the score.

130.speaker: Oliver
130.text: We're done when I say we're done.

34.speaker: Oliver
34.text: Boo! I scared you - I saw it. Nobody beats me at hide and seek.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player turns their head left and right, sensing something. Oliver jumps up from bottom of frame, trying to jumpscare the player.

104.speaker: Halsin
104.text: That's him - like an echo of Thaniel, remoulded by the curse. We need him, if we're to put a stop to all of this.
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin whispers, trying to not alert OliverNodeContext: Urgent, determined. Whispered, so not to alert Oliver.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *Though shrouded in shadows, the child's resemblance to Thaniel is unmistakable. This must be his dark half - warped by the curse.*

122.speaker: Oliver
122.text: I'm Oliver. I'm seven. Will you play with me?

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Play? This is no place for a child - if that's even what you are.

148.speaker: Oliver
148.text: Of course I am! Now are you going to play with me or not?

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Don't startle people like that - easy way to wind up killed by mistake.

116.speaker: Oliver
116.text: Killed? Nobody dies around here, silly. Not like that. Play with me, and you'll see for yourself.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: You're not what you say you are. I can sense it.

77.speaker: Oliver
77.text: I don't know what you mean. I'm just me. I have a mummy, a daddy, a pet doggy.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Don't you have anyone else to play with?

17.speaker: Oliver
17.text: I have a mummy, a daddy, and a doggy. They'll be back in a while. But you're here now. And I want to play.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: What are your parents' names? Maybe I can find them.

11.speaker: Oliver
11.text: They don't need names. They just need to be mummy and daddy, and do what I want. Now play with me, or they'll be angry with you.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *The boy doesn't like these questions - because he has no real answers. And perhaps no real family.*

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I know who you really are, and where you really belong. You need to reunite with Thaniel.

113.speaker: Oliver
113.text: I'm not going back. I like it here - I've made a family for myself, I get to play all the time.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Like it or not, you don't belong here.

109.speaker: Oliver
109.text: Yes I do. You can't make me do anything.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Don't make this harder than it needs to be.

144.speaker: Oliver
144.text: I don't want to play with you anymore.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: This land needs you and Thaniel together, Oliver. Nature needs you.

176.speaker: Oliver
176.text: You can't make me do anything I don't want to. I won't let you.

129.speaker: Oliver
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lunges at OliverNodeContext: Alarmed/resistant

170.speaker: Halsin
170.text: He's fled - we need to track him down. Wherever the curse is strongest, that's where he'll go. That's where he'll feel safe.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: That little bastard - where'd he go?
75.context: NodeContext: Not too mean, in a jaunty way (talking about a kid)

50.speaker: Jaheira
50.text: Fled back to the shadows, no doubt. Come out, boy, or this mean old Harper might get cranky.
50.context: NodeContext: Weary sigh, second line calling out to the darkness at a cursed child who's growing tiresome

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: Back to the shadows. After him, ra'stil - we need to see this through.

84.speaker: Wyll
84.text: He's gone - and we need to follow. He'll feel the safest where the shadows are deepest.

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: He's scarpered. We'd better track him down - if the shadows don't stop us first.

137.speaker: Gale
137.text: He's scarpered - and I suppose it's up to us to find him.

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: Slippery little bugger, isn't he? He'll be looking for somewhere safe - somewhere where the shadows are nice and strong.

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *Wherever Oliver has fled to, you have to pursue him. No doubt he will seek a place where the shadows are strongest.*

158.speaker: Player
158.text: You're no ordinary little boy, are you? I can sense it.

121.speaker: Oliver
121.text: I don't know what you mean. The shadows must be making your head go funny.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Sorry, I don't think they're coming back. Want to come to my camp?

56.speaker: Oliver
56.text: I'm not going anywhere. I like it here. Now play with me, or else.

106.speaker: Oliver
106.text: All right. I'll hide, and you seek.

175.speaker: Halsin
175.text: Let's make this quick. We need to reunite him with Thaniel.
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin whispers, trying to not alert OliverNodeContext: Urgent. Whispered.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: And if I don't find you?

139.speaker: Oliver
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: ShrugNodeContext: Smallest hint of menace laced into an innocent-seeming statement.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I've changed my mind. You're on your own.

61.speaker: Oliver
61.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadow family appears and  combat ensues

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Face facts, kid. Your family's dead - and you might be too.

150.speaker: Oliver
150.text: You shouldn't be nasty. You should just do what I want. It's easier for you, that way.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Have you seen another little boy around here? He's called Thaniel - he's very special.

164.speaker: Oliver
164.text: He's not special - he's nothing. You shouldn't say that name. Forget you ever heard it.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Study the boy. Try to understand his true nature.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Not an ordinary child, but not a spectre either. One part of a greater whole. Something ancient. And oddly... sad?*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *Something is amiss about the boy - but exactly what eludes you.*

43.speaker: Player
43.text: A familiar magic exudes from this boy. Try to commune with it.

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *Below the layers of shadow and curse, you sneak a fleeting glance of this creature's true nature.*

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *Too many layers of shadow and curse obscure the familiar, latent magic of the child.*

108.speaker: Player
108.text: The child's ki feels... uneven. At odds. Why?

123.speaker: Player
123.text: In a moment maybe. Have you seen another little boy? His name is Thaniel.

36.speaker: Oliver
36.text: I don't know anyone called that. Don't ask me again.
36.context: NodeContext: distressed - a memory is stirring that you're trying to supress

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I don't have time for this.

93.speaker: Oliver
93.text: Make time. I want to play. Or else.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I can play you a little song  - would you like that?

172.speaker: Oliver
172.text: Not that kind of playing, silly - I want to play a game! It'll be really fun, let me show you.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Unsual magic pours from the creature. What is it?

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Another presence lingers near the boy. Study him, try to discern what it is.

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Unlike your patron, the presence isn't separate. It's more part of the boy. You focus your gaze on him.*

35.speaker: Oliver
35.text: I won fair and square. There's no point in playing again - I want a challenge.

31.speaker: Oliver
31.text: Go on. Find someone else to play with.

74.speaker: Oliver
74.text: You weren't supposed to find me. You weren't supposed to win.
74.context: NodeContext: More confused than angry, like the impossible has happened.

152.speaker: Oliver
152.text: Good idea - you're smarter than some playmates I've had. They always tried to leave before I was done with them.

69.speaker: Oliver
69.text: You're not my mummy or my daddy - don't tell me what to do.

12.speaker: Oliver
12.text: Let's play another game - I deserve a chance to even the score.

76.speaker: Oliver
76.text: Try to find me again - but my family will be looking for you at the same time, so don't get caught!

90.speaker: Oliver
90.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadow family appears after the dialogue and combat ensues

153.speaker: Oliver
153.text: We're finished when I say we're finished.

112.speaker: Oliver
112.text: You ruined my fun - I don't want to talk to you.

119.speaker: Oliver
119.text: Hmph. You're good at this - are you sure you didn't cheat?

159.speaker: Oliver
159.text: But I can't let you think me a bad sport. Here's your prize. You'll need it.

145.speaker: Oliver
145.context: NodeContext: On alert - sensing the player means him harm

162.speaker: Oliver
162.text: I win! I always win, in the end.

1.speaker: Oliver
1.text: You did better than most though, so I'll let you go. Here - second prize. You'll need it.
